benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/paymentMethods/refresh - Refresh account payment methods

covered: PUT: Valid Request: Thoroughly covered — 204 and actual refresh asserted across base case, pluginName/pluginProperty variations, optional headers, and edge cases with no existing payment methods (TC01–07, TC21–22, TC28).
PUT: Non-Existing Resource: 404 for unknown accountId and empty DB states verified (TC09, TC27).
PUT: Concurrency Issues: Concurrent requests/heavy-load behavior tested, with response-time targets and data integrity checks (TC14, TC23, TC29).
Input Validation: Path UUID format and oversized accountId (400), unsupported pluginName (400), malformed pluginProperty (400) are covered (TC08, TC11–12, TC19).
Headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy present/missing behaviors verified; optional Reason/Comment accepted (TC05, TC10).
Resiliency/Integration: External gateway/plugin service failures and timeout paths handled (502/503/504), and post-refresh data consistency validated (TC13, TC20, TC25–26).
Security: Basic injection/XSS defenses validated in query parameters (TC16–17).
Query parameters: collectionFormat=multi for pluginProperty, handling of extra parameters, and large payload boundaries covered (TC03–04, TC18, TC24).
gaps: PUT: Concurrency/race-condition specifics are not asserted (e.g., overlapping refreshes for the same account producing a single consistent final state and avoiding duplicate gateway calls).
Response semantics: No checks that 204 responses have an empty body/Content-Length=0, or that error responses carry Content-Type: application/json as per “Produces” and honor Accept negotiation.
Unexpected 500 Internal Server Error path (e.g., database or internal service failure) is not covered.
Authorization depth: 403 Forbidden for authenticated-but-unauthorized roles/tenants is not tested (only 401).
Plugin property semantics: typical key=value format, duplicate keys, empty values, and whitespace/encoding edge cases are not explicitly validated.
Header robustness: boundary/validation tests for X-Killbill-CreatedBy/Reason/Comment (empty, overly long, invalid characters) are missing.
HTTP method constraints: 405 Method Not Allowed for unsupported verbs on this resource is not tested.
Auditability: No scenario asserts that CreatedBy/Reason/Comment are captured in audit logs/metadata.
recommendations: Add explicit race-condition/idempotency tests: fire two or more simultaneous refreshes for the same account and verify a single consistent final state and at-most-once gateway invocation.
Validate 204 response semantics: assert no response body and Content-Length=0; also assert error responses include Content-Type: application/json and respect the Accept header.
Simulate internal failures (e.g., DB outage) and assert a 500 with a structured error payload.
Add RBAC/tenant test: authenticated user without permission receives 403 Forbidden.
Expand pluginProperty tests to cover key=value format, duplicate keys (last-wins vs rejected), empty values, and tricky encoding (e.g., key=a=b, spaces).
Add header boundary tests for X-Killbill-CreatedBy/Reason/Comment (empty string, max length, non-UTF8 or control characters).
Verify method constraints by sending GET/POST/DELETE to the same path and expecting 405 Method Not Allowed.
Tighten Gherkin expectations to single, deterministic status codes per scenario (avoid “204 or 400/413/422”), or split into separate scenarios per outcome.
